poem:
### The Silence of Marketing

Bright banners flutter  
above crumbled stone—  
a gloss of lies.  

Whispered truths  
swept beneath sand,  
innocence buried,  
laughter echoes  
unheard.

Gilded voices murmur,  
smoothing edges sharp—  
silenced hearts struggle,  
yet persist.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US marketing companies are helping to rebrand the genocide in Gaza | Arwa Mahdawi If a tree falls in a forest and no one is around to hear it, does it make a sound? You’ve heard that one before, but here’s a new version of the thought experiment: if a genocide takes place but you prevent foreign journalists from observing it, kill the key witnesses and spend hundreds of millions of dollars on propaganda, then". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
